title: How padded jackets went from country casual to Silicon Valley stealth wealth
text:
It’s been almost two weeks since the season two finale of hit Sky Atlantic series Succession prompted jaws on the floor, Twitter frenzies and a host of fan theories. For those unfamiliar with the pastiche of a Murdoch-style feuding family, it charts the dastardly plotting of the siblings to usurp the monstrous head of the household, Logan Roy.

Plotting aside, the most notable element was that the media mogul and his Lear-esque offspring eschewed power suits and solid shoulder tailoring in favour of comfy knits, cosy gilets and plump padded jackets – the sort of get-up you’d expect from Jerry from The Good Life, not a New York boardroom behemoth.

But with the rise of the “athleisurewear” trend...
description: It’s been almost two weeks since the season two finale of hit Sky Atlantic series Succession prompted jaws on the floor, Twitter frenzies and a host of fan theories.
